books.title: The Souls of Black Folk
books.author: W. E. B. Du Bois
books.summary: A seminal collection of essays on the African-American experience.

books.title: Kidnapped
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: After his parents die, a young Scottish man travels to see his only remaining relative, expecting to be welcomed, but instead finds his life and liberty in grave danger.

books.title: Yashka
books.author: Maria Bochkareva
books.summary: A Russian peasant leaves exile in Siberia to fight for her country in World War I.

books.title: Personal Recollections of Joan of Arc
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: A fictional biography of Joan of Arc from her early teenage years to her martyrdom.

books.title: The Shore Road Mystery
books.author: Franklin W. Dixon
books.summary: Two amateur slueths endeavor to break up a carjacking ring.

books.title: Mike
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A boy’s adventures in public school are filled with cricket, colorful characters, and a great deal of fun at the expense of authoritarian school masters.

books.title: Antigone
books.author: Sophocles
books.summary: A young woman defies the king’s decree to honor her brother with a proper burial.

books.title: Master Flea
books.author: E. T. A. Hoffmann
books.summary: A gentleman bachelor gains an epic advantage of tiny proportions in this allegorical, Romantic, fairy-tale novel.

books.title: Pimpernel and Rosemary
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: A famous journalist is drawn into the intrigues of two Eastern European nations in the aftermath of World War I.

books.title: The Three Impostors
books.author: Arthur Machen
books.summary: Two flâneurs in Victorian London get caught up with the members of a secret society and their search for a rare Roman coin.

books.title: Seven Pillars of Wisdom
books.author: T. E. Lawrence
books.summary: T. E. Lawrence’s memoir of leading the Arab revolt against the Ottoman empire during World War I.

books.title: Fantômas
books.author: Pierre Souvestre
books.summary: A shapeshifting arch-villain terrorizes Parisian society.

books.title: The Humbugs of the World
books.author: P. T. Barnum
books.summary: American archetype and cultural founding father P. T. Barnum shares a collection of anecdotes that he deems “humbugs”—fodder for the gullible, deserving of skepticism—with the goal of making his fellow citizens a little wiser and more skeptical.

books.title: On Liberty
books.author: John Stuart Mill
books.summary: Mill’s famous essay that applies a utilitarian ethical system to systems of government.

books.title: The Odyssey
books.author: Homer
books.summary: An epic poem following a Greek hero trying to return home after the Trojan war.

books.title: Dodsworth
books.author: Sinclair Lewis
books.summary: A newly-retired businessman’s peaceful European trip falls apart as his wife chases high European society.

books.title: The Night Land
books.author: William Hope Hodgson
books.summary: A 17th-century gentleman is reincarnated on a far-future Earth where the sun has died, and scours the hellish landscape for his lost love.

books.title: Lord Arthur Savile’s Crime and Other Stories
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A collection of Oscar Wilde’s short mysteries.

books.title: Practical Mysticism
books.author: Evelyn Underhill
books.summary: Evelyn Underhill makes the case that mysticism is accessible and beneficial to everyone.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.
